articles.title: Common Household Cleaning Product Found To Release Trillions of Microplastic Fibers - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Melamine sponges release trillions of microplastic fibers monthly, posing environmental risks. Making denser sponges and using alternative cleaning methods are recommended solutions. If you've ever owned white shoes or attempted to scrub crayon marks off a wa…
articles.content: Research reveals that melamine sponges, commonly used for cleaning, release over a trillion microplastic fibers globally each month due to wear and tear. These fibers can contaminate water systems an… [+3276 chars]
